newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian June castor drops on speculative selling.
newsitem.headline: Indian June castor drops on speculative selling.

text.p: Castorseed June delivery dropped further to 1,083/1,084 rupees per quintal from 1,088 rupees on fresh speculative selling, dealers said on Wednesday.
"Continued pressure of arrivals at the producing centres and sluggish overseas demand dragged prices lower but trading volume remained very slow," one dealer said.
"Trading has dropped considerably following introduction of daily clearing system by the exchange authorities," he added.
"Castorseed September delivery nominally quoted at 1,170/1,175 rupees per quintal but no trading took place today," he said.

Daily average arrivals of castorseed in the Gujarat region remained higher at 25,000/30,000 bags (75 kg each). Foreign buyers demanded Indian castoroil at 690 dollars per tonne but Indian offers were at 705/710 dollars.

Groundnut oil held steady at 355/357 rupees per 10 kg on stray seasonal buying but sentiment was subdued on continued arrivals of imported edible oil at Bombay port. Imported palm-oil fell by 1/2 rupees at 279/280 rupees per 10 kgs. In Rajkot spot groundnut oil was steady at 560 rupees per 15 kgs.
The Bombay oil and oilseed ready market will be open on Thursday but exchange authorities have decided to close the castorseed forward delivery category for a Buddhist festival.
